required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Action Observation on Neck Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Action Observation on Pain Intensity, Muscle Strength, Tactile Acuity and Pressure Pain Threshold.

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the immediate effects of action observation therapy on the cervical muscles' strength, pain intensity, tactile acuity and pain pressure threshold in individuals with chronic nonspecific neck pain.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a randomized controlled trial with two arms: action observation group vs control group. The action observation group will be asked to watch videos of neck exercises with full attention and concentration and not perform any motion or execute any movement during the observation time. The control group will be asked to watch videos of a landscape.
Participants will be assessed at baseline and at post-intervention for muscle strength, pain intensity, pressure pain threshold and tactile acuity.

primary_outcome.description: Pressure pain thresholds are the minimum amount of pressure applied with an algometer that is perceived as being painful; is measured in Kgf

primary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (within the same session of the baseline assessment but approximately 30 minutes after that).
primary_outcome.description: Pressure pain thresholds are the minimum amount of pressure applied with an algometer that is perceived as being painful; is measured in Kgf

secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a 100 mm Visual Analogue Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (within the same session of the baseline assessment but approximately 30 minutes after that).
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a 100 mm Visual Analogue Scale
Assessed as the ability of the participant to distinguish two points using a caliper and the measurement units is millimetres.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (within the same session of the baseline assessment but approximately 30 minutes after that).
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed as the ability of the participant to distinguish two points using a caliper and the measurement units is millimetres.
A dynamometer will be used against the forehead of the participants to quantify the isometric strength and units of measurement will be Newtons.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (within the same session of the baseline assessment but approximately 30 minutes after that).
secondary_outcome.description: A dynamometer will be used against the forehead of the participants to quantify the isometric strength and units of measurement will be Newtons.
A dynamometer will be used against the posterior part of the head of the participants to quantify the isometric strength and units of measurement will be Newtons.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (within the same session of the baseline assessment but approximately 30 minutes after that).
secondary_outcome.description: A dynamometer will be used against the posterior part of the head of the participants to quantify the isometric strength and units of measurement will be Newtons.
A dynamometer will be used against the lateral aspect of the head of the participants to quantify the isometric strength and units of measurement will be Newtons.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (within the same session of the baseline assessment but approximately 30 minutes after that).
secondary_outcome.description: A dynamometer will be used against the lateral aspect of the head of the participants to quantify the isometric strength and units of measurement will be Newtons.

other_outcome.description: Measured with the Catastrophizing Scale (range 0-52 and higher values are indicative of higher pain catastrophizing)
Measured using the Neck Disability Index (Range: 0 - 50 and higher values indicate higher disability)
Measured with the TAMPA Scale of Kinesiophobia (range: 13-52 and higher values are indicative of higher levels of fear of movement)
Measured with the Fear-Avoidance Beliefs Questionnaire (range: 0-66 with higher scores indicating higher fear-avoidance beliefs)

arm_group.description: Participants will be asked to watch videos of neck exercises without performing any exercise. The intervention will take approximately 15 minutes.
Participants will be asked to watch videos of landscapes. The intervention will take approximately 15 minutes.

intervention.description: Action observation therapy involves the observation and perception of human movement performed by others. The observation of actions performed by others activates in the perceiver the same neural structures responsible for the actual execution of those same actions.
Participants will watch a natural landscape without any human.

overall_official.affiliation: School of Health Sciences, University of Aveiro
